themes.scientific_basis: Based on research in parenting styles and their impact on child development.
themes.description: This theme helps couples discuss and align on their parenting philosophies, such as discipline approaches, education priorities, and values they want to instill in their children.

themes.scientific_basis: Inspired by financial planning research for family expansion.
themes.description: This theme guides couples in assessing their financial situation, including budgeting for childcare, education, and other expenses, to ensure a stable foundation for their future family.

themes.scientific_basis: Grounded in research on work-life balance and time allocation in families.
themes.description: This theme helps couples plan how to balance parenting responsibilities, work, and personal time, ensuring that both partners feel supported and engaged.

themes.scientific_basis: Based on studies showing the importance of a strong couple relationship before transitioning to parenthood.
themes.description: This theme encourages couples to prioritize their relationship, building resilience and closeness to face parenting challenges together.

themes.scientific_basis: Drawn from research on equitable division of labor in parenting and household tasks.
themes.description: This theme helps couples plan how to share parenting and household responsibilities fairly, minimizing potential conflicts and fostering teamwork.

themes.scientific_basis: Inspired by family systems theory, emphasizing the influence of extended family on parenting.
themes.description: This theme explores how couples can navigate relationships with extended family, establishing boundaries and roles for grandparents, aunts, and uncles in their child's life.

themes.scientific_basis: Based on research in emotional preparation and self-regulation for new parents.
themes.description: This theme helps couples assess their emotional readiness for parenthood, including strategies for managing stress and staying connected during challenging times.

themes.scientific_basis: Drawn from research on the role of rituals and traditions in family bonding.
themes.description: This theme encourages couples to plan traditions and routines they want to establish, creating a sense of identity and connection for their future family.

themes.scientific_basis: Grounded in developmental psychology and child-rearing research.
themes.description: This theme introduces couples to key developmental milestones, preparing them to support their child's growth and adapt to their evolving needs.

themes.scientific_basis: Based on research on social support and its importance for new parents.
themes.description: This theme helps couples identify and cultivate a network of family, friends, and professionals to support them during the transition to parenthood.
